docs.title: Problem
docs.text: Today’s university curriculum focuses heavily on theory, but when students enter internships or jobs, they face a major gap. Most students struggle with practical tools like Git, Linux, Docker, MERN, Laravel, and Spring Boot that are essential in today’s software industry. Because of this lack of hands-on experience, students often feel unprepared, confused, and less confident in real-world work environments.

docs.title: Motivation
docs.text: Our motivation is to bridge the gap between academic theory and industry requirements. We believe that students should have access to a platform that not only teaches them concepts but also allows them to practice with real-world tools in a guided environment. This helps in building confidence and competence, ensuring they are job-ready upon graduation.

docs.title: Solution
docs.text: BeyondClass is a Practical Skills Learning Platform designed to solve this gap. It is a web-based platform built with Next.js 16 that teaches real industry tools through curated videos, hands-on practice, AI feedback, and certificates. - Interactive: Students don't just watch; they write code and get graded instantly by AI. - Structured: The database ensures a logical progression from "Introduction" to "Advanced Concepts" via locked/unlocked modules. - Rewarding: Visual progress tracking and downloadable PDF certificates provide tangible goals.

docs.title: Project Timeline
docs.text:
• Phase 1: Concept & Design (Brainstorming, UI/UX).
  • Phase 2: Frontend Development (Next.js, Tailwind CSS).
  • Phase 3: Backend Service Integration (Supabase, API Routes).
  • Phase 4: AI Integration (Feedback generation).
  • Phase 5: Testing & Refinement (Final Stable Build).
  • Phase 6: Final Report & Deployment (Current Stage).

docs.title: Final Status
docs.text: BeyondClass is now a fully functional learning platform with integrated AI features, robust testing, and automated documentation deployment.

docs.title: Tech Stack
docs.text:
• Frontend Framework: Next.js 16.0.10 (App Router)
  • Language: JavaScript / React 19.2.3
  • Styling: Tailwind CSS 4.1.18
  • Backend/Database: Supabase (PostgreSQL) with Row Level Security (RLS)
  • Authentication: Supabase Auth
  • AI Integration: Vercel AI SDK (ai ^4.3.19) + Google Provider (@ai-sdk/google)
  • PDF Generation: jspdf ^3.0.4 (Client-side)
  • Diagrams: mermaid ^11.12.2
  • Markdown Rendering: react-markdown + remark-gfm

docs.title: Features Overview
docs.text:
BeyondClass offers a comprehensive suite of features designed to enhance practical learning:

  1. Module-Based Learning System: Structured learning paths focused on specific skills (Git, Linux, MERN, etc.).
  2. AI-Assisted Assignments & Auto-Grading: Interactive coding tasks with instant feedback powered by AI.
  3. Skill Certificates & Portfolio Builder: Automatic certificate generation and portfolio creation to showcase achievements.
  4. AI Learning Assistant (BeyondClass Agent): Personalized tutoring and intelligent resource generation (Studio).

docs.title: Testing Strategy
docs.text: BeyondClass employs a comprehensive testing strategy covering distinct levels of the application: Unit Testing for individual components and Performance Testing for system stability under load.

docs.title: 1. Unit & Integration Testing (Jest)
docs.text: We use Jest along with React Testing Library to verify that individual UI components and utility functions work as expected.

docs.title: Tech Stack
docs.text:
• Runner: Jest (jest)
  • Environment: jsdom (Simulates a browser environment for React)
  • Utilities: @testing-library/react, @testing-library/jest-dom

docs.title: Test Types
docs.text:
• Component Tests: Checks if components render correctly (e.g., Header, Footer).
  • Snapshots: Ensures UI does not change unexpectedly.

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
npm test
# or
npm run test

docs.title: 2. Performance Testing (K6)
docs.text: We use Grafana k6 to simulate traffic and ensure the platform can handle real-world usage.

docs.title: Tech Stack
docs.text:
• Tool: k6 (Open source load testing tool)
  • Scripts: Located in k6-tests/ directory.

docs.title: Test Types
docs.text:
• Smoke Test (smoke.js): Verifies the system is up and running with minimal load.
  • Load Test (load.js): Simulates average traffic (e.g., 20 concurrent users).
  • Stress Test (stress.js): Pushes the system to its breaking point.
  • Soak Test (soak.js): Runs for a longer duration to check for memory leaks.
  • Spike Test (spike.js): Simulates sudden bursts of traffic.

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text: k6 run k6-tests/load.js

docs.title: User Side Guide (Getting Started)
docs.text:
1. Sign Up: Create an account on the BeyondClass platform.
  2. Browse Courses: Navigate to the dashboard to see available modules.
  3. Start Learning: Click on a module (e.g., "Git Mastery") to begin lessons.
  4. Submit Assignments: At the end of a module, complete the task and submit your code for AI feedback.

docs.title: Programmer Side Guide (Getting Started)
docs.text:
1. Clone the Repository: bash git clone https://github.com/amzayedabdullah/BeyondClass.git cd BeyondClass
  2. Install Dependencies: bash npm install
  3. Set Up Environment:
    • Create a .env.local file.
    • Add Supabase credentials (NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL, NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY) and AI API keys.
  4. Run Development Server: bash npm run dev Open http://localhost:3000 with your browser.

docs.title: AI Learning Assistant (BeyondClass Agent)
docs.text: The BeyondClass Agent is a core component of the platform, designed to provide personalized assistance and intelligent content generation for students.

docs.title: 1. Personalized Tutoring
docs.text: Students can interact with the AI Agent to ask questions about course material, clarify complex concepts, and receive step-by-step guidance on assignments.

docs.title: 2. Intelligent Note-Taking
docs.text: The agent helps students organize their thoughts by automatically summarizing key points from lessons and generating structured notes that can be saved to their profile.

docs.title: 3. Resource Generation (Studio)
docs.text: The "Studio" feature allows students to generate additional learning resources from provided input: - Audio Overviews: Listen to a synthesized summary of the lesson. - Video Overviews: Visual summaries with key highlights. - Quizzes: Test knowledge with AI-generated questions. - Flashcards: Quick review cards for active recall. - Data Tables: Structured summaries of technical data.

docs.title: Technical Integration
docs.text: The agent is built using the Vercel AI SDK with the Google Gemini Pro model, ensuring fast and accurate responses. It is fully integrated with the Supabase backend for persistent conversation history and note storage.

docs.title: Non-Technical Description
docs.text: Each module ends with an industry-style practical task. Workflow: 1. Students submit code for an assignment. 2. The system tests it. 3. AI provides instant, friendly feedback, allowing students to improve immediately.

docs.title: Technical Implementation
docs.text:
AI Integration: - Library: ai (Vercel AI SDK) and @ai-sdk/google. - Model: Google Generative AI (e.g., Gemini) is configured for text generation.

Backend Workflow (/api/assignment/submit): 1. Input Processing: Receives assignmentId, answers, and userId. 2. Context Retrieval: Fetches the specific assignment questions and rubric from the assignments table in Supabase. 3. AI Grading: - Constructs a prompt containing the question, student's answer, and correct answer criteria. - Calls generateText to evaluate the submission. - Returns a JSON object with score, feedback per question, and general_feedback. 4. Progression Logic: - If score >= 70, the system updates lesson_progress table. - Automatically finds the next lesson (based on sort_order) and unlocks it by ensuring an entry exists in lesson_progress with is_unlocked: true.

docs.title: Non-Technical Description
docs.text: Students earn certificates to showcase their skills and build a professional identity. Workflow: 1. Every completed module generates a skill certificate. 2. Completing all modules unlocks the full course certificate. 3. Tasks and projects automatically appear in a shareable portfolio.

docs.title: Technical Implementation
docs.text: Client-Side PDF Generation: - Library: jspdf. - Component: CertificationCard.jsx. - Logic: - The certificate is generated entirely in the browser (no server load). - Initializes a jsPDF instance with landscape orientation (600x400 px). - Styling: - Draws a border using doc.rect(20, 20, 560, 360) with a 10px line width. - Uses custom fonts ("helvetica", "times") for typography hierarchy. - Specifically centers text using { align: "center" } coordinates (e.g., Student Name at x: 300). - Dynamic Data: Injects userName and course.title directly into the canvas. - Output: Triggers a download via doc.save('${course.title}_Certificate.pdf').

docs.title: Non-Technical Description
docs.text: The platform is organized into practical, skill-focused modules such as Git, Linux, Bash, MERN, Laravel, and more. Workflow: 1. Students pick a module. 2. Lessons appear in short, structured sections with curated videos. 3. Progress is tracked automatically as they learn at their own pace.

docs.title: Technical Implementation
docs.text:
Database Schema (Supabase): The curriculum is structured using a relational model in PostgreSQL/Supabase: - modules Table: Groups lessons together. - Columns: id, course_id, title, sort_order. - lessons Table: Contains the actual content. - Columns: id, module_id, title, video_url, content (Markdown), duration, is_preview. - Foreign Key: module_id references modules(id).

API Architecture: - Endpoint: GET /api/course/[id]/curriculum - Logic: 1. Fetches all modules for the course, ordered by sort_order. 2. Extracts all module_ids. 3. Performs a single optimized query to fetch all lessons where module_id is in the list (using .in('module_id', moduleIds)). 4. Maps lessons to their respective modules in memory to construct a nested JSON response. - Benefit: Reduces database round-trips compared to querying lessons for each module individually (N+1 problem).
